title: SH 121 photos

pageHeader.title: Driving Views Southbound
pageHeader.subTitle: I-35E to DFW Airport
pageHeader.lastUpdated: Created March 8, 2009. Last updated June 1, 2015 (review and update captions)

text: This includes about two miles of the Sam Rayburn Turnpike, and then the main lanes become the untolled SH 121. 2015 update: Several projects have most of the photos below obsolete. The obsolete images are indicated.

images.caption: Driving southbound/westbound on SH 121 with I-35E ahead.

imageStatus.note: In 2015 work is in progress to add four new connections to the interchange
In 2015 work is in progress to add four new connections to the interchange
In 2015 work is in progress to add four new connections to the interchange
In 2015 work is in progress to add four new connections to the interchange

images.caption: Approaching the merge point with business 121.
End of the Sam Rayburn Turnpike. Going ahead is freeway.

imageStatus.note: In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.

images.caption: Ahead is an at-grade intersection at Coppell Road.

imageStatus.note: The highway was made into a freeway in 2009. In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.
The highway was made into a freeway in 2009. In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.

images.caption:
Approaching the signalized intersection at Freeport Parkway. Work is in progress in 2009 to construct an
					overpass at this location.

imageStatus.note: The highway was made into a freeway in 2009. In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.
The highway was made into a freeway in 2009. In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.

images.caption: Another signalized intersection at Sandy Lake Road. In 2009 work is in progress to construct an overpass.

imageStatus.note: The highway was made into a freeway in 2009. In 2015 work is in progress to expand the freeway.

images.caption: The freeway resumes south of Sandy Lake Road.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.

images.caption: The freeway curves to go in the due south direction toward DFW Airport. I-635 is just ahead.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The freeway was widened as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The freeway was widened and reconfigured as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
The interchange at SH 114 was rebuilt and expanded as part of the DFW Connector project, completed in 2013.
